pullRequest.body:
We are not that far from the point that `Algebra/Group/Defs` depends on nothing significant besides `simps` and `to_additive`.

This removes from `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Defs` the dependencies on
* `Mathlib.Tactic.Basic` (which is a grab-bag of random stuff)
* `Mathlib.Init.Algebra.Classes` (which is ancient and half-baked)
* `Mathlib.Logic.Function.Basic` (not particularly important, but it is barely used in this file)

The goal is to avoid all unnecessary imports to set up the *definitions* of basic algebraic structures. 

We also separate out `Mathlib.Tactic.TypeStar` and `Mathlib.Tactic.Lemma` as prerequisites to `Mathlib.Tactic.Basic`, but which can be imported separately when the rest of `Mathlib.Tactic.Basic` is not needed.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Can you
* explain the motivation in the PR description
* give a more precise description than "reduce imports". Here you're getting rid of the dependency on `Injective`

Personally I'm wondering why you're trying to get rid of `Injective`. I understand you would like to carve out an algebraic order hierarchy library, but
* `Injective` could (should?) very well live ahead of that library since it could be in Std
* later files in the algebraic order hierarchy really need some basics of `Injective`, `Equiv`...

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> From my reading, you're not attached to having injectivity lemmas be in a new file on their own. Therefore could they go in `Algebra.Group.Basic`?

Done.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7555429404/job/20570388734)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7555429404/job/20570388992)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7555429404/job/20570389571)

Nice work!

For the benefit of future readers, could you also note the changes to `Tactic.Basic` in the PR description?

bors d=@YaelDillies

Nice work!

For the benefit of future readers, could you also note the changes to `Tactic.Basic` in the PR description?

bors d=@YaelDillies
From my reading, you're not attached to having injectivity lemmas be in a new file on their own. Therefore could they go in `Algebra.Group.Basic`?

```suggestion
As the unbundled algebraic structures typeclasses are of somewhat dubious use at present,
```

Should `Tactic.Basic` import `Lemma`/`TypeStar`? For user convenience it would be good if we had some way of easily getting all the fundamental notations. Certainly it's important that we provide `Type*` to avoid the drawbacks of `Type _`.
Done.

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Cancel
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.Shapes.Zero
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.End
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Discrete
```

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Defs
import Mathlib.Logic.Function.Basic
import Mathlib.Logic.Nontrivial.Defs
```

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Defs
import Mathlib.Init.Logic
import Mathlib.Tactic.Cases
```
Do the linters allow us to add some sort of warning here that this file is not supposed to gain any imports?
You can mimic that via `assert_not_exists`
Done.
Similarly, is there a reason to have this in a separate file?
To delay importing a file that we would like to get rid of, so that someone needing just the definitions of basic structures doesn't need to think about it.
Sorry, I meant "separate to `Algebra.Group.Basic`", not "separate to `Algebra.Group.Defs`".
That would be fine.
Mind moving that to `Algebra.Group.Basic` then?
Done.

Ah, now I see the problem (and so I've undone it): this would then require `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.WithOne.Defs` to import `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Basic`, rather than just `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Classes`.

I'll add an `assert_not_exists` for this.
For reference, what in `Algebra.Group.WithOne.Defs` is requiring `Algebra.Group.Classes`? Maybe these should be moved to `Algebra.Group.WithOne.Basic` instead.

It is
```
@[to_additive]
instance monoid [Semigroup ] : Monoid (WithOne ) :=
  { WithOne.mulOneClass with mul_assoc := (Option.liftOrGet_isAssociative _).1 }

@[to_additive]
instance commMonoid [CommSemigroup ] : CommMonoid (WithOne ) :=
  { WithOne.monoid with mul_comm := (Option.liftOrGet_isCommutative _).1 }
```
which does belong there in `Defs` rather than `Basic`.

I was a bit surprised to see that
```
@[to_additive]
instance commMonoid [CommSemigroup ] : CommMonoid (WithOne ) :=
  { WithOne.monoid with
    mul_comm := fun a b => match a, b with
    | some a, some b => congr_arg some (mul_comm a b)
    | some a, none => rfl
    | none, some b => rfl
    | none, none => rfl }
```
doesn't typecheck, with

```
type mismatch
  congr_arg some (mul_comm a b)
has type
  some (a * b) = some (b * a) : Prop
but is expected to have type
  some a * some b = some b * some a : Prop
```
and similarly on the `rfl`s.
It actually works as expected. I suspect it failed for you because you didn't make sure `WithOne.monoid` was sorry-free before working on `WithOne.commMonoid`.
I think `IsCommutative` and `IsAssociative` are part of the few ones we'll keep. See the module doc of `Init.Algebra.Classes`.
The module doc says that they are still used, not that they are a good idea, I think.
I guess @digama0 can clarify the intended meaning, but we'll need some version of them regardless. Maybe a non-class predicate. But we need *something*.
Sure, but I think this is orthogonal to this PR, we don't need any version of them here.
@semorrison, was moving these declarations to the root namespace (instead of leaving them in `Mathlib.Tactic`) deliberate?
